content:
Given the data points (x= 10, y=20, z=15) calculate the mean.
10, 20, 15

To calculate the mean of the data points, you need to sum all the values and then divide by the number of data points.

Given data points: \(x = 10\), \(y = 20\), \(z = 15\).

Mean = \(\frac{x + y + z}{3} = \frac{10 + 20 + 15}{3} = \frac{45}{3} = 15\).

So, the mean of the data points is 15.
